result.execSummary:
The defendant John F Mccormack was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Assisting Suicide, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.12.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay all court costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, DNA surcharge.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  To be paid by the end of the probationary period. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any fiearms/body armor; and that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
No contact with any members of the deceased's family, residences, and places of employment.

AODA and other mental health counseling needs to be determined. 
Take all prescription medications.
$2,495.00 to Kris Chapman to be paid first, then  $1,000.00 to Milwaukee County Burial Program.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorneys Gabriela Leija and Deborah Susan Vishny.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Kristina C.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 6 YEARS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, with credit for 144 days time served.  CONFINEMENT of 3 YEARS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 3 YEARS.  The Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation to the State Department of Corrections for a period of 3 YEARS by the Mental Health Unit.  Conditions of probation include:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and restitution in the amount of $3,495 be paid by the end of the probationary period. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Restitution stipulated to by defendant. $2495 to Kris Chapman. $1000 to Milwaukee County Burial Program. Ms. Chapman to be paid first.
-Pay all court costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-AODA and other mental health counseling needs to be determined.
-Take all prescribed medications.
-Seek and maintain full-time employment.
-No contact with any members of the deceased's family, residences, and places of employment.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The defendant is advised that voting rights are suspended during length of sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.     
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Filed:
Notice of right to seek post-conviction relief
Pre-sentencing credit
Ineligible voting Notice
Restitution information filed by the state.
Defense is moving to modify bail to which the state has no objection.  The court will modify bail to $1000 PR Bond and defendant is to reside at 5031 N. 106th St., Milwaukee, WI 53225.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case was set for trial today and has resolved.  As to the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Case is adjourned to 6-18-2015 at 8:15 for sentencing.
State's response to defense motion in limine, received and filed.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated May 7, 2015 received and filed. tk
Motion in LImine to PReculde Preducial Evidence and Set oForth Procedural Trial Matter, received and filed. tk
State's Requested Jury Instructions received and filed. tk
State's WItness List received and filed.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Defense waived right to Miranda Good Child. Case remains in trial posture. Jury trial remains scheduled for jury trial June 1, 2015.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case remains scheduled for jury trial on June 01, 2015

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny and Gabriella Leija.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting an adjournment of the final pretrial to 5-8-2015; state has no objection.
Defense counsel is to discuss waiver of miranda-goodchild with defendant to be addressed on FPT.
Defense has not filed any motions; Motion in Limine will be filed by next date.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Gabriela A. Leija.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The court was provided with a Stip and Order yesterday outlining the placement of defendant in Silverlawn Crisis Respite Facility after bail modification to a PR bond.  The state was in ageement with the modification and conditions.  Today, however, the court is informed that the facility will no longer accept the defendant.  The state no longer agrees to bail modification.  
THE COURT ORDERS THE STIPULATON AND ORDER RESCINDED.  Bail is to remain at $1000 cash TOT Justicepoint.
If another placement facility becomes available the court will allow matter to be brought back into court.
Stipulation signed by ADA Paul Tiffin and Atty Gabriela Leija; Order Modifying Bail signed by the court and filed.

Scheduling conference held.    Case set for final pretrial on 5-4-2015 at 8:15am.  Jury trial set for 6-1-2015 at 8:15am.  All final pretrial documents to be filed by the final pretrial hearing.  All motions to be filed by 3-30-2015.  Any evidentiary hearing will be held on FPT date.
Atty Vishny informs the court that she may be assigning this case to another lawyer due to a possible calendar conflict.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense is requesting that bail be modified to a PR with TOT Justicepoint for placement at Pathways to be effectuated on March 3, 2015.  The state will stipulate to modification.  
The court will take under advisement and set for a review on March 3 at 8:15.  A stipulation signed by all parties is to be submitted with all conditions of release and transportation of defendant outlined.
Atty Vishny requests that scheduling conference and bail hearing be moved to 2-26-2015 at 8:15.  State has no objection.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Gabriela Leija for Deborah Susan Vishny.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.  Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Deborah Susan Vishny and attorney Gabriela Leija.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Paul L. Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for return on doctor's report. Court reviewed the doctor's report written by Dr. Pankiewicz with parties. Parties are not challenging the finding of the report. Court accepts the findings of Dr. Pankiewicz and finds the defendant competent to proceed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense Attorney Vishny unavailable this morning, matter put over to 02-03-2015 at 8:15am.
Report of Dr. Pankiewicz dated 1-28-2015 received and filed.

Defendant John F Mccormack in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant John F Mccormack in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WAGNER, Branch 38.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  COURT EXTENDS THE TIME LIMITS FOR THE PRELIMINARY HEARING.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
